channel.title: Dark Reading
channel.description: Dark Reading: Connecting the Information and Security Community

item.title: MSPAlliance Leadership Council Forms Vendor Council to Address Managed Services Supply Chain Risk
item.description: MSP supply chain threats will be mitigated through transparency, education, business continuity planning, and managed services channel certification.

item.title: BT to Deploy 'Epidemiological AI' Based on the Spread of Viruses in Humans to Combat Cyberattacks
item.description: Using the spread of viruses in human populations as a model to inform its AI, Inflame is a key component in BT’s recently-announced Eagle-i platform.

item.title: Ankura Launches Brooklyn Cyber Center
item.description: New initiative addresses shortage of professionals and lack of diversity in cybersecurity by recruiting, training and retaining diverse talent from underrepresented backgrounds.

item.title: Emerging Security Tools Tackle GraphQL Security
item.description: New security tools are proactively protecting APIs built with GraphQL, before attacks against them become more commonplace.
item.dc:creator: Fahmida Y. Rashid, Features Editor, Dark Reading

item.title: Open Source Project Aims to Detect Living-Off-the-Land Attacks
item.description: The machine learning classifier from Adobe can determine whether system commands are malicious and classify them using a variety of tags useful for security analysts.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: Follow the Leaders: A Blueprint for Software Security Success
item.description: Organizations can study software security leaders and emulate their habits and initiatives in order to build a successful software security program of their own.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Ewers, Principal Security Consultant, Synopsys Software Integrity Group

item.title: How to Hire ﻿— and Retain ﻿—﻿ Effective Threat Hunters
item.description: Key characteristics that should be evaluated include curiosity, disposition, and fit with the culture.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Jones, Senior Director, Cyber Security Services at Dataprise

item.title: In Appreciation: Alan Paller
item.description: Alan Paller, founder of the famed SANS Institute, passed away on Nov. 9.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: 'Lyceum' Threat Group Broadens Focus to ISPs
item.description: New report suggests attacker is targeting trusted supply chain companies in order to compromise large numbers of downstream customers.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: Google Open Sources ClusterFuzzLite
item.description: ClusterFuzzLite is a stripped-down version of continuous fuzzing tool ClusterFuzz that integrates CI tools.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: How Do I Know It's Time to Consider a SASE Migration?
item.description: The rapid shift to a hybrid workplace and accelerated adoption of new technologies means it's time to rethink networking security approaches.
item.dc:creator: Shaila Shankar, SVP and General Manager, Cisco Cloud Network and Security

item.title: What Happens If Time Gets Hacked
item.description: Renowned hardware security expert raises alarm on the risk and dangers of cyberattackers targeting the current time-synchronization infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: Kelly Jackson Higgins, Executive Editor

item.title: Cloud Attack Analysis Unearths Lessons for Security Pros
item.description: Researchers detail their investigation of a cryptomining campaign stealing AWS credentials and how attackers have evolved their techniques.
item.dc:creator: Kelly Sheridan, Senior Editor

item.title: Third-Party Software Risks Grow, but So Do Solutions
item.description: Enterprises are more dependent than ever on open source software and need to manage the risk posed by vulnerabilities in components and third-party vendors.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: Insider IP Theft Is Surging — and Most Can't Stop It
item.description: The Great Resignation is upon us, and insider IP theft is surging as a result. But it is a solvable problem.

item.title: Should Our Security Controls Be More Like North Korea or Norway?
item.description: When the drive for additional visibility and awareness is led by the business rather than just a SOC team, both the business and security can benefit.
item.dc:creator: Sounil Yu, CISO and Head of Research of JupiterOne

item.title: New Application Security Toolkit Uncovers Dependency Confusion Attacks
item.description: The Dependency Combobulator is an open source Python-based toolkit that helps developers discover malicious software components that may have accidentally been added to their projects.
item.dc:creator: Fahmida Y. Rashid, Features Editor, Dark Reading

item.title: Hacker-for-Hire Group Spied on More Than 3,500 Targets in 18 Months
item.description: Russian-speaking "Void Balaur" group's victims include politicians, dissidents, human rights activists, doctors, and journalists, security vendor discloses at Black Hat Europe 2021.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: ChaosDB: Researchers Share Technical Details of Azure Flaw
item.description: Wiz researchers who discovered a severe flaw in the Azure Cosmos DB database discussed the full extent of the vulnerability at Black Hat Europe.
item.dc:creator: Kelly Sheridan, Senior Editor

item.title: Firms Will Struggle to Secure Extended Attack Surface in 2022
item.description: Companies are relying more heavily on third parties, remote employees, and partners, expanding their attack surface area beyond traditional boundaries.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: SquirrelWaffle Leverages Malspam to Deliver Qakbot, Cobalt Strike
item.description: Threat is spreading widely via spam campaigns, infecting systems with a new malware loader.
item.dc:creator: Edmund Brumaghin, Cisco Talos Threat Researcher

item.title: SolarWinds Vulnerability Exploited in First Stage of Clop Ransomware Attacks
item.description: Russian cybercrime group known as T505 is targeting SolarWinds Server-U systems that haven't been patched for a remote code execution vulnerability fixed this summer.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Defining the Hierarchy of Value in Cyber Intelligence
item.description: One size won't fit all as we try to reconcile the need to demonstrate expertise and value with keeping clients and researchers safe.
item.dc:creator: Adam Darrah, Director of Threat Intelligence Services, ZeroFox

item.title: CISA and State and Local Partners Test Emergency Response Plans at Chevron Salt Lake Refinery
item.description: The exercise included several objectives related to response procedures at the refinery, including evacuation and shelter-in-place decision-making; roles and responsibilities during investigations; communication with first responders; and public messaging before and following an incident.

item.title: 4 Tips to Secure the OT Cybersecurity Budget You Require
item.description: OT security engineers and personnel should approach senior management with an emphasis on risk reduction benefits and with a concrete plan to secure budget and funding before it's too late.
item.dc:creator: Jim Crowley, CEO at Industrial Defender

item.title: Securing the Public: Who Should Take Charge?
item.description: International policy expert Marietke Schaake explores the intricacies of protecting the public as governments depend on private companies to build and secure digital infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: Kelly Sheridan, Senior Editor

item.title: Researcher Details Vulnerabilities Found in AWS API Gateway
item.description: AWS fixed the security flaws that left the API service at risk of so-called HTTP header-smuggling attacks, says the researcher who discovered them.
item.dc:creator: Kelly Jackson Higgins, Executive Editor

item.title: Dark Reading Video News Desk Comes to Black Hat Europe
item.description: While attendees join Black Hat Europe 2021 virtually and live in London, we bring you prerecorded interviews from remote offices around the world.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Microsoft Fixes Exchange Server Zero-Day
item.description: November security update contains patches for 55 bugs — including six zero-days across various products.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: Are You Planning for the Quantum, Transhumanist Threat?
item.description: Breaking encryption in a day and hacking without visible devices are two threats that could become a reality in the next decade and beyond, experts say.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: Why Self-Learning AI Is Changing the Paradigm of ICS Security
item.description: By focusing on the organization rather than the threat, AI can identify subtle changes in your digital environment that point to a cyber threat.
item.dc:creator: Oakley Cox, Director of Analysis, Darktrace

item.title: Zoho ManageEngine Flaw Highlights Risks of Race to Patch
item.description: Attackers used a pre-auth vulnerability in a component of the enterprise management software suite to compromise businesses, highlighting the dangers of Internet-facing software.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: How to Minimize Ransomware's Trail of Destruction and Its Associated Costs
item.description: One of the biggest mistakes an organization can make is blindly throwing technology at the problem instead of properly investing in building a security team.
item.dc:creator: Jake Williams, CTO of BreachQuest

item.title: 83% of Critical Infrastructure Organizations Suffered Breaches, 2021 Cybersecurity Research Reveals
item.description: Supply chain and third-party risk is a major threat to operational technology.

item.title: SafeBreach Closes $53.5 Million Series D in New Funding to Fuel Momentum
item.description: The new capital will fuel the company's plans to expand its market footprint to new geographies and evolve its offerings in response to client needs.

item.title: The State of the CISO
item.description: Dark Reading survey shows security officer influence is on the rise.

item.title: Building Bridges to a More Secure Hybrid Workplace
item.description: Wherever workers choose to do their jobs, they need technology that's unobtrusive, secure by design, and intuitive to use.
item.dc:creator: Ian Pratt, Global Head of Security for Personal Systems at HP Inc.

item.title: Edge Chat With Cisco Secure CTO TK Keanini on Achieving Better Security Outcomes
item.description: Now is the time for organizations to rethink their security strategies with a platform- and architecture-based approach in mind. Keanini explains.
item.dc:creator: Edge Editors, Dark Reading

item.title: UL Launches SafeCyber Platform to Secure IoT
item.description: UL’s SafeCyber will allow organizations to manage cybersecurity governance and processes as well as speed up time spent on firmware development.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: US Charges Ukrainian National for Kaseya Ransomware Attack
item.description: Yaroslav Vasinskyi is one of seven individuals believed to be responsible for deploying REvil ransomware in attacks against 5,000 organizations.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: What Security Strategies Are Driving InfoSec's Decisions Around Defense?
item.description: The data shows security leaders are focusing on multilayered defenses, including multifactor authentication, threat intelligence, and incident response.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Investor Group to Acquire McAfee for $14B
item.description: The group, made up of Advent, Permira, Crosspoint Capital, CPP Investments, GIC, and ADIA, will take ownership of McAfee.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: What My Optometrist Taught Me About InfoSec Presentations
item.description: A broken pair of eyeglasses brings into focus an important lesson about how to tailor security messages to the right audience.
item.dc:creator: Joshua Goldfarb, Director of Product Management at F5

item.title: Arctic Wolf Security Operations Cloud Reaches Massive Scale and a Global Footprint
item.description: Global business momentum and technical advancements position the Arctic Wolf platform as a category-defining Security Operations solution

item.title: Kaspersky Finds DDoS Attacks in Q3 Grow by 24%, Become More Sophisticated
item.description: The total number of smart attacks (advanced DDoS attacks that are often targeted) increased by 31% when compared to the same period last year.

item.title: Banking Malware Threats Surging as Mobile Banking Increases – Nokia Threat Intelligence Report
item.description: The Nokia 2021 Threat Intelligence Report announced today shows that banking malware threats are sharply increasing as cyber criminals target the rising popularity of mobile banking on smartphones, with plots aimed at stealing personal banking credentials and credit card information.

item.title: Valeo Networks Acquires On Time Tech, Accelerating National Growth Strategy
item.description: Through this latest acquisition, the company adds two more California locations.

item.title: Could Cyber Diplomacy Be the Ultimate Answer to American Ransomware Woes?
item.description: Incentives for good conduct and deterrents for bad behavior in cyberspace are impossible to effectively establish and enforce without international collaboration and commitment.
item.dc:creator: Cristin J. Monahan, Cyber Vault Fellow at National Security Archive

item.title: SecureAuth Buys Acceptto to Deliver Low-Friction Authentication to Enterprises
item.description: Acceptto’s contextual behavior threat intelligence technology will help SecureAuth deliver AI-driven MFA and continuous password-less authentication, SecureAuth says.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: 3 Ways to Deal With the Trojan Source Attack
item.description: These scripts and commands provide short-term fixes for blocking the Trojan Source attack that abuses Unicode to inject malicious backdoors int source code.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: US Defense Contractor Discloses Data Breach
item.description: Electronic Warfare Associates says an attackers infiltrated EWA email in August, which led to the exfiltration of files with personal data.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Who's Minding Your Company's Crypto Decisions?
item.description: Security teams must first evaluate security protocols and the reputation of the cryptocurrency payment platform before their companies can proceed to accept the alternative currency as payment.
item.dc:creator: Tatiana Walk-Morris, Contributing Writer

item.title: How InfoSec Should Use the Minimum Viable Secure Product Checklist
item.description: Google and Salesforce executives discuss the need for the newly released MVSP, how tech companies came together to work on it, and how organizations should use it.
item.dc:creator: Kelly Sheridan, Senior Editor

item.title: To Secure DevOps, Security Teams Must be Agile
item.description: The evolution of agile development and infrastructure-as-code has given security teams the tools they need to gain visibility, find vulnerabilities early, and continuously evaluate infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: 4 Tips on How Small to Midsize Businesses Can Combat Cyberattacks
item.description: The first step in improving your cybersecurity is understanding your risk of attack.
item.dc:creator: John Roman, President and COO of FoxPointe Solutions

item.title: How Is Zero Trust Different From Traditional Security?
item.description: Unlike traditional security approaches, the zero-trust security model verifies a user's identity each and every time they need specific system access.
item.dc:creator: Ash Devata, General Manager, Cisco Zero Trust and Duo Security

item.title: API Security Issues Hinder Application Delivery
item.description: A new survey explains why nearly all organizations experience API security problems to varying degrees.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: Ripping Off the Blindfold: Illuminating OT Environments
item.description: A security tool that monitors OT devices can't disrupt operations. This is why the Self-Learning AI acts only on information obtained by passive monitoring of the network.
item.dc:creator: Oakley Cox, Director of Analysis, Darktrace

item.title: US Offers $10M Reward For ID, Location of DarkSide Leadership
item.description: The State Department offers multimillion-dollar rewards for information related to the leaders and members involved in DarkSide ransomware.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Phishing Attack Blends Spoofed Amazon Order and Fraudulent Customer Service Agents
item.description: It's the latest in a series of clever brand impersonation scams that use multiple vectors to lure victims.
item.dc:creator: Steve Zurier, Contributing Writer

item.title: Appsian Security Announces Acquisition of Q Software, a Leader in JD Edwards Security and Compliance
item.description: The acquisition provides customers of JD Edwards, along with Oracle EBS and Oracle Cloud, with expanded capabilities for data masking, threat detection and response, and real-time analytics across multiple ERP applications.

item.title: Having Trouble Finding Cybersecurity Talent? You Might Be the Problem
item.description: Hiring managers must rethink old-school practices to find the right candidates and be ready to engage in meaningful conversations about their company's values. Here are three ways to start.
item.dc:creator: Jamie Tomasello, Head of Security Programs and Security GRC at Gusto

item.title: Coalfire Expands Application Security Vision With Major Upgrade to Application Security Platform, ThreadFix
item.description: ThreadFix v3.1 delivers fastest speed for AppSec automation and remediation.

item.title: How to Avoid Another Let's Encrypt-Like Meltdown
item.description: Experts weigh in on steps network and security administrators need to take before the next time a root certificate expires.
item.dc:creator: Andrada Fiscutean, Contributing Writer

item.title: Researchers Scan the Web to Uncover Malware Infections
item.description: Dozens of companies and universities regularly scan the Internet to gather data on connected devices, but some firms are looking deeper to uncover the extent of detectable malware infections.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: CISA Issues New Directive for Patching Known Exploited Vulnerabilities
item.description: The goal is to reduce civilian federal agency exposure to attacks that threat actors are actively using in campaigns, agency says.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: 5 MITRE ATT&CK Tactics Most Frequently Detected by Cisco Secure Firewalls
item.description: Cisco Security examines the most frequently encountered MITRE ATT&CK tactics and techniques.
item.dc:creator: Ben Nahorney, Threat Intelligence Analyst, Cisco Security

item.title: Cloud Data Security Startup Launches
item.description: TrustLogix aims to streamline and simplify data governance in the cloud.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Where Is Cloud Permissions Management Headed?
item.description: Cloud permissions management emerged as a standalone cloud security technology but is quickly becoming part of a broader set of capabilities
item.dc:creator: Rik Turner, Principal Analyst, Infrastructure Solutions, Omdia

item.title: US Blacklists Israeli Firms NSO Group and Candiru
item.description: The US Commerce Department has also added Russia's Positive Technologies and Singapore's Computer Security Initiative Consultancy.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Infosec and Business Alignment Lowers Breach Cost, Boosts Security
item.description: As attacks and security budgets continue to rise, data shows the most secure organizations are the ones that strike a security-business balance.
item.dc:creator: Kelly Sheridan, Senior Editor

item.title: Is Sandboxing Dead?
item.description: Organizations should start to evaluate other security measures to replace or complement the once-venerable security sandbox.
item.dc:creator: Gilad David Maayan, Technology Writer

item.title: Valtix Delivers Free Cloud Security for Departmental, Development, and Test Applications
item.description: Company aims to make cloud network security more accessible to all organizations.

item.title: Risk Quantification: A Powerful Tool in Your Cyberthreat Defense Arsenal
item.description: Three ways that understanding your cyber-risk in real dollars can help your organization survive the threat of ransomware and other attacks.
item.dc:creator: Prasad Sabbineni, CTO, MetricStream

item.title: Simulation Game Teaches Non-Security Staff How to Handle a Cyber Crisis
item.description: In this card-based game from Kaspersky, players work through a cyberattack scenario and learn how each decision they make has consequences.
item.dc:creator: Seth Colaner, freelance writer

item.title: Cloud, Remote Work Will Change How IT Uses Vulnerability Scanners
item.description: Tenable added Raspberry Pi support to Nessus v10.0 to help security professionals conduct audits and assessments remotely.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Attackers Flaunt Remote Access Credentials, Threaten Supply Chain
item.description: Attackers advertise access to computers within shipping and logistics companies as the global supply chain struggles to meet post-COVID demands.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: The Executive Women's Forum on Information Security, Risk Management & Privacy Elects Three Board Advisers
item.description: Security executives hail from Target, Eli Lilley, and SecurityCurve/SaltCybersecurity.

item.title: Dragos Launches ServiceNow’s OT Asset Discovery App
item.description: Integration with Dragos Platform will help joint customers to expand the visibility of ICS/OT assets.

item.title: Vaultree Raises $3.3M for Encryption Solution
item.description: The company's platform uses Enhanced Searchable Symmetric Encryption (ESSE) and Fully Homomorphic Encryption (FHE) technologies.

item.title: 44% of Parents Struggle to Follow Tech Rules They Set for Their Kids
item.description: Parents perceive norms of behavior to be different for themselves and their children, according to Kaspersky..

item.title: Microsoft Expands Security to AWS in Multicloud Push
item.description: Microsoft will expand its cloud security tools to AWS within a suite called Defender for Cloud and launch a new Defender for Business in preview later this month.
item.dc:creator: Kelly Sheridan, Senior Editor

item.title: FBI: Ransomware Actors Use Financial Events to Extort Victims
item.description: Attackers research financial information about an organization and threaten to disclose it if they don't receive ransom quickly.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Laika Raises $35M Series B to Help Companies Prepare for Security Audits
item.description: Laika helps companies establish robust compliance practices to meet the strict requirements from regulators and enterprise customers.

item.title: China Hosts More Malware Than Russia: Findings from DNSFilter's 2021 Domain Threat Report
item.description: Cryptomining has also had a resurgence over the last year as blockchain technology and NFTs rise in popularity.

item.title: Female-Founded Cybersecurity Startup Wabbi Raises Over $2M in Seed Funding
item.description: Wabbi enables companies to assimilate application security processes into development pipelines to produce and scale application security across enterprises.

item.title: Phishing and Spam Lures Feature Sports, Aim to Steal Credentials
item.description: Spam volume declined slightly in the third quarter, but attackers sent almost 36 million malicious email attachments, up 5% from the previous quarter, one security firm says.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: SaaS and Third-Party Risk: Is Your Organization Asking the Hard Questions?
item.description: An investment in due diligence might prevent your organization from being part of next week's breach news cycle.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Benoit-Kurtz, Lead Cybersecurity Faculty, University of Phoenix

item.title: How Hackers Are Targeting Cryptocurrency
item.description: Crypto exchanges that want to maintain credibility must implement some of the same "know your customer" controls used by banks and similar institutions.
item.dc:creator: John LaCour, Founder and CTO of PhishLabs by HelpSystems

item.title: How AI-Driven Security Analytics Speeds Up Enterprise Defense
item.description: Fresh off a $250 million Series E round, Devo Technology plans to expand the core security analytics platform with new features to help enterprise defenders work with security data faster and more effectively.
item.dc:creator: Fahmida Y. Rashid, Features Editor, Dark Reading

item.title: CISA and Partners Coordinate on Security, Combatting Misinformation for Election Day
item.description: CISA will host an election situational awareness room to coordinate with federal partners, state and local election officials, private sector election partners, and political organizations to share real-time information and provide support as needed.

item.title: Zscaler’s 2021 Encrypted Attacks Report Reveals 314% Spike in HTTPS Threats
item.description: Massive increase in cyberattacks targeting technology and retail industries confirms immediate need for zero-trust security

item.title: New 'Trojan Source' Method Lets Attackers Hide Vulns in Source Code
item.description: Researchers discover a new technique attackers could use to encode vulnerabilities into software while evading detection.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: CrowdStrike to Buy Zero-Trust SaaS Provider
item.description: SecureCircle provides data-level zero-trust control to endpoints.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: SonicWall: 'The Year of Ransomware' Continues with Unprecedented Late-Summer Surge
item.description: 2021 will be the most costly and dangerous year on record.

item.title: Free Tool Scans Web Servers for Vulnerability to HTTP Header-Smuggling Attacks
item.description: A researcher will release an open source tool at Black Hat Europe next week that roots out server weaknesses to a sneaky type of attack.
item.dc:creator: Kelly Jackson Higgins, Executive Editor

item.title: Name That Edge Toon: Parting Thoughts
item.description: Feeling creative? Come up with a clever caption, and our panel of experts will reward the winner with a $25 Amazon gift card.
item.dc:creator: John Klossner, Cartoonist

item.title: Understanding the Human Communications Attack Surface
item.description: Companies should recognize that collaboration platforms aren't isolated, secure channels where traditional threats don't exist.
item.dc:creator: Otavio Freire, CTO & President, SafeGuard Cyber

item.title: Enterprises Allocating More IT Dollars on Cybersecurity
item.description: Enterprises are allocating more IT dollars toward implementing a multilayered approach to securing data and applications against new threats, data shows.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Snyk Agrees to Acquire CloudSkiff, Creators of driftctl
item.description: New capabilities allow Snyk Infrastructure as Code customers to more effectively detect infrastructure drift.
